intro: Monadenium shebeliense, commonly known as the Ethiopian star grass, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a star-like pattern, which are clustered in dense heads. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
